intro: Matelea diversifolia, commonly known as the showy morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to violet, often with a yellow throat. The plant belongs to the family Convolvulaceae, which includes other flowering vines and herbs. It typically grows as a climbing plant with slender stems and heart-shaped leaves. Matelea diversifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and full sun.
